refnamediv.refpurpose: arrays of pointers to any type of data, which grow automatically as new elements are added.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Pointer Arrays are similar to Arrays but are used only for storing pointers.

note.para: If you remove elements from the array, elements at the end of the array are moved into the space previously occupied by the removed element. This means that you should not rely on the index of particular elements remaining the same. You should also be careful when deleting elements while iterating over the array.

refsect1.para: To create a pointer array, use g_ptr_array_new().
To add elements to a pointer array, use g_ptr_array_add().
To remove elements from a pointer array, use g_ptr_array_remove(), g_ptr_array_remove_index() or g_ptr_array_remove_index_fast().
To access an element of a pointer array, use g_ptr_array_index().
To set the size of a pointer array, use g_ptr_array_set_size().
To free a pointer array, use g_ptr_array_free().

example.title: Using a GPtrArray

refsect2.title: GPtrArray
refsect2.para: Contains the public fields of a pointer array.

listitem.simpara: points to the array of pointers, which may be moved when the array grows.
number of pointers in the array.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GPtrArray.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_sized_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GPtrArray with reserved_size pointers preallocated. This avoids frequent reallocation, if you are going to add many pointers to the array. Note however that the size of the array is still 0.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_add ()
refsect2.para: Adds a pointer to the end of the pointer array. The array will grow in size automatically if necessary.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes the first occurrence of the given pointer from the pointer array. The following elements are moved down one place.
It returns TRUE if the pointer was removed, or FALSE if the pointer was not found.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the pointer is removed. FALSE if the pointer is not found in the array.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_remove_index ()
refsect2.para: Removes the pointer at the given index from the pointer array. The following elements are moved down one place.

listitem.simpara: the index of the pointer to remove.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_remove_fast ()
refsect2.para: Removes the first occurrence of the given pointer from the pointer array. The last element in the array is used to fill in the space, so this function does not preserve the order of the array. But it is faster than g_ptr_array_remove().
It returns TRUE if the pointer was removed, or FALSE if the pointer was not found.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the pointer was found in the array.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_remove_index_fast ()
refsect2.para: Removes the pointer at the given index from the pointer array. The last element in the array is used to fill in the space, so this function does not preserve the order of the array. But it is faster than g_ptr_array_remove_index().

listitem.simpara: the index of the pointer to remove.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_remove_range ()
refsect2.para: Removes the given number of pointers starting at the given index from a GPtrArray. The following elements are moved to close the gap.

listitem.simpara: the index of the first pointer to remove.
the number of pointers to remove.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_sort ()
refsect2.para: If two array elements compare equal, their order in the sorted array is undefined.

note.para: The comparison function for g_ptr_array_sort() doesn't take the pointers from the array as arguments, it takes pointers to the pointers in the array.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_sort_with_data ()
refsect2.para: Like g_ptr_array_sort(), but the comparison function has an extra user data argument.

note.para: The comparison function for g_ptr_array_sort_with_data() doesn't take the pointers from the array as arguments, it takes pointers to the pointers in the array.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_set_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the size of the array, expanding it if necessary. New elements are set to NULL.

listitem.simpara: the new length of the pointer array.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_index()
refsect2.para: Returns the pointer at the given index of the pointer array.

listitem.simpara: the index of the pointer to return.
the pointer at the given index.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees all of the memory allocated for the pointer array.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE the array of pointers (pdata) is freed.
NULL if free_seg is TRUE, otherwise the array of pointers (pdata) is returned.

refsect2.title: g_ptr_array_foreach ()
refsect2.para: Calls a function for each element of a GPtrArray.

listitem.simpara: the function to call for each array element
user data to pass to the function

refsect2.para: Since 2.4
